banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Climate change is our reality. Here's how we're taking action
videoData.socialTitle: Climate change is our reality. Here's how we're taking action
videoData.presenterDisplayName: Al Gore, Gloria Kasang Bulus, Nana Firman, Ximena Loría and Tim Guinee

learnModules.blurb: Learn how you can help cut the world's emissions in half by 2030, in the race to a zero-carbon world.
learnModules.headline: Countdown: A global initiative to accelerate solutions to the climate crisis

nodes.whoTheyAre: Gloria Kasang Bulus has dedicated her life to promoting environmental ethics, sustainable use of natural resources and preserving the natural environment for future generations.
nodes.whyListen:
Gloria Kasang Bulus is an environmentalist concerned about the global destruction of nature. Through her work as the founder of the nonprofit Bridge That Gap Initiative, she created a network of Civil Society in Environment (NCSE) raising awareness of the current climate crises, influencing environmental actions and confronting the complexities of environmental governance in Nigeria. 

Bulus's educational background includes a master's in Natural Resource Management and climate change and master's in Renewable Energy. She also has a PGD in Geographic Information System, BSc in Environmental Studies and Resource Management, a professional certificate in Environmental Public Health and Water Safety and Hygiene. She was trained as a Climate Reality Leader in 2017 in Seattle, under the tutelage of the former vice president of America, Al Gore, and she is currently the West Africa Regional Coordinator for African Climate Reality Project (ACRP). 

Bulus also received the Alfredo Sirkis Memorial Green Ring Award, presented by Al Gore, for having demonstrated an exceptional commitment to her role as climate communicator and activist.

nodes.whoTheyAre: Nana Firman wants to unite the world behind a commitment to sustainability and environmental justice.
nodes.whyListen:
Nana Firman has nearly two decades of experience in advocacy and awareness-raising on environmental degradation and the climate crisis, advocating for urban sustainability and developing green economy concepts and strategies. She's currently the Muslim outreach director for GreenFaith, a global multi-faith and spiritual environment and climate action network. She previously worked with the World Wildlife Fund in Indonesia, directing the green recovery efforts in the wake of 2004 earthquake and tsunami and later developing a sustainable city initiative as part of urban climate adaptation and mitigation.

Upon moving to the US from her native Indonesia in 2012, Firman has been involved in encouraging the American Muslim community to practice an eco-friendly lifestyle, which prompted her to initiate the Green Mosque Project for Islamic Society of North America. In 2015, she organized the Islamic Declaration on Global Climate Change and later cofounded the Global Muslim Climate Network, which calls all Muslim nations to transition from fossil fuel to clean energy as the basis of development.

In 2015, Firman was named a White House "Champion of Change" by President Barack Obama. Recently, she received the Alfredo Sirkis Memorial Green Ring Award for climate activism excellence from the former Vice President Al Gore. She holds a bachelor's degree in industrial design from University of Bridgeport, Connecticut, and a master's degree in urban design from the Pratt Institute in New York. She lives in California with her husband, Jamal Yusuf Ali, a US Navy veteran and entrepreneur.

nodes.whoTheyAre: Ximena Loría works to expose the human cost of environmental problems.
nodes.whyListen:
Costa Rican biologist and activist Ximena Loría founded Misión 2 Grados, an NGO focused on four main topics: sensitizing people to climate change, supporting the B corp movement, advancing public policy and bolstering the development of young leaders.

Early in her career, Loría researched biological pest control in agriculture. Working with farmers in rural communities showed her how lack of education and access to resources made people responsible for and victims of environmental degradation in their communities. In 2009, she earned a master's degree in natural resources and peace from the UN's University for Peace, where she was further inspired in her work to raise awareness of climate change. After graduation, she worked as a biology and ecology teacher for high school and university students, focusing on empowering youth as change makers.

After working with the Climate Reality Project, Loría founded Misión 2 Grados and is now focused on the creation of an active youth climate network and a creating climate change reform agenda in the Costa Rican congress. She's coleading a national movement of citizens, organizations and private sector companies to prohibit the exploration and exploitation of hydrocarbons in Costa Rica.

nodes.whoTheyAre: Tim Guinee is a passionate advocate for creating a more sustainable world.
nodes.whyListen:
Tim Guinee is a leader with former Vice President Al Gore's Climate Reality Project. He is also an actor, bee-keeper, firefighter and wire-walker.

Guinee first learned about the climate crisis in 1976 in a letter from Jaques Cousteau. The letter described what scientists at the time were predicting: the melting of the polar ice caps, the dissolution of glaciers worldwide and more. During his lifetime, Guinee has seen many of these changes come to pass.

Guinee is the founder of the Climate Actors, an organization that empower actors by providing them with facts and tools to speak with authority on the climate crisis, amplifying the unique skills actors possess to advance solutions.

nodes.whoTheyAre: Al Gore continues to focus the world's attention on the global climate crisis.
nodes.whyListen:
Former Vice President Al Gore is the founder and chairman of The Climate Reality Project, a nonprofit devoted to solving the climate crisis, a founding partner and chairman of Generation Investment Management and a cofounder of Climate TRACE. He is also a partner at Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, a member of Apple’s board of directors and a member of the World Economic Forum’s board of trustees. Gore is the author of numerous books on the climate crisis and our collective future and the subject of the 2006 Oscar-winning documentary An Inconvenient Truth and An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power, released in 2017.

Gore was first elected to the US House of Representatives in 1976, to the US Senate in 1984 and became vice president in 1992. In 2007, he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, along with the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, for "informing the world of the dangers posed by climate change."

videoData.description: With the Climate Reality Project, Al Gore is helping mold future leaders to build the movement for climate survival and social justice from the ground up. He introduces us to four of the Project's graduates, each of whom confronts climate change on their own terms: Ximena Loría, founder of Misión 2 Grados, an NGO influencing public policy in Central America; Nana Firman, "daughter of the rainforest" and advocate for climate justice among Indigenous peoples; Gloria Kasang Bulus, a Nigerian activist for women and education; and Tim Guinee, a first responder and climate change fighter in upstate New York. Together, they're gathering local actors into a global, grassroots movement that aims to turn the climate fight around.
videoData.socialDescription: With the Climate Reality Project, Al Gore is helping mold future leaders to build the movement for climate survival and social justice from the ground up. He introduces us to four of the Project's graduates, each of whom confronts climate change on their own terms: Ximena Loría, founder of Misión 2 Grados, an NGO influencing public policy in Central America; Nana Firman, "daughter of the rainforest" and advocate for climate justice among Indigenous peoples; Gloria Kasang Bulus, a Nigerian activist for women and education; and Tim Guinee, a first responder and climate change fighter in upstate New York. Together, they're gathering local actors into a global, grassroots movement that aims to turn the climate fight around.

cues.text: 高爾：大家好，我是高爾，
「氣候真相計畫」的創辦人和主席。
這個重大的挑戰和失去的時刻，
很顯然也是大覺醒
和大機會的時刻。
全球疫情、

結構性和制度性的種族主義
及其相關的可怕暴力、
氣候危機愈趨嚴重的衝擊——
這些狀況都表示我們需要盡快

讓廣泛的大眾
對我們和大自然之間的連結
有新的了解，
也要了解不理會科學的後果，

以及我們為所有人建立
公正社會的神聖義務。
「氣候真相計畫」訓練全世界
195 國的數千名氣候領袖，
以提倡人類應得的未來。
接下來會有四位經過一週訓練
且背景各異的人

來談談他們如何受到鼓舞，
決定採取行動。

我想讓他們自己說明，
首先是希美娜羅利亞。
希美娜在中美洲致力於影響公共政策
並開發新的年輕領袖。

她已經向數以千計的人
做過關於氣候的簡報，

現在也已成立了
她自己的非政府組織。

希：我是來自哥斯大黎加的
希美娜羅利亞。

我參加了 2016 年
在德州休士頓舉辦的訓練。
訓練後，我的人生完全改變了。

我成立了非政府組織
「Misión 2 Grados」。
我的工作著重在四個主題上：
增加人們對於氣候變遷的感受性、
支持 B 型企業運動、
推動公共政策，
以及培養環境相關議題的年輕領袖。
我很驕傲我已做過至少一百五十場
關於氣候危機和解決方案的簡報，
親自接觸到至少七千五百人。

我也很驕傲能加入
哥斯大黎加代表團，

於去年十二月參與
在西班牙舉辦的 COP25。
高：娜娜費爾曼在印尼出生，
她是個非凡的氣候擁護者，
自稱為雨林的女兒。
娜娜是「綠色信仰」的穆斯林協調人

以及「全球穆斯林氣候網」
的共同創辦人。

娜：我是娜娜費爾曼，
我是氣候真相領袖。
在我人生的旅程中，我了解到
我們的行為和消費習慣
促成了環境惡化
並造成了全球暖化。
然而，我相信，
人的心靈是透過
和地球的密切關係來成長。
我出生在蘇門答臘的雨林區，
我相信我們的森林有能力可以成為
氣候危機的自然解決方案，
只要能給予原住民和傳統社區部落

更多權力來保護和管理
他們居住的森林。
比起以往，
現在我們更需要將氣候正義
作為我們奮鬥時最優先的重點。
高：在北奈及利亞的卡杜納地區，

葛蘿莉亞卡森布勒斯
被稱為氣候危機女王。

葛蘿莉亞在卡杜納
成立了一間非政府組織，
致力於教育、賦權及氣候。

葛：我是葛蘿莉亞卡森布勒斯。
我偶然知道了氣候真相訓練，
在 2017 年申請參加，

該訓練協助了我
在後續發展我的能力。
它也激起了我對氣候行動的熱忱。
我對我的一些成就感到非常驕傲。
我的成就之一就是接觸兒童。

另一項我很驕傲的成就
就是能夠讓媒體團結，
來談論氣候變遷，
每季針對氣候變遷進行討論。
針對氣候，我所做的一些事
真的讓我以身為氣候真相領袖
及氣候活動家為榮。
高：提姆蓋尼是紐約的消防隊員，
也是氣候真相計畫
在哈德遜谷卡茲奇分會的主席。
他和他的分會取得了
超過一百間企業、學校、城市的承諾，
保證會百分之百採用可再生能源。

提：我是提姆蓋尼，
我以身為氣候真相計畫的成員為傲。
2001 年九月十日，

那天晚上我和我的朋友
派迪布朗隊長一起行動，
他是紐約市打火史上
最功勳彪炳的消防隊員，
也是三號消防車的出色成員。
我在大約早上六點半、七點時回家，
沒多久後，
他們接到通報，
並出動至世貿中心。
他們爬上樓，
沒有一個人回來。

我不知道如果他們事先知道
會發生什麼事的話
還會不會去做，
那全是猜測。
但我知道的是他們向前邁進，
走向他們的命運。
我認為氣候危機
和那個時刻有些共通點。
沒有人希望氣候變遷出現在自家門口，
但它就是來了。
這是我們的歷史現實。
而我們必須要做選擇。
我們的命運是要決定
我們是否要針對氣候危機做出因應，
或者要假裝它沒有發生，
否認它。
我認為這是決定我們命運的時刻，
我希望你也決定參與，
對抗氣候危機，
因為我們需要你。
高：四個人，
四個成功和改革的故事。
在這個「倒數計時」活動之後，
美國東部標準時間下午四點，
全世界就會展開「二十四小時真相」，
其中有數千場由氣候領袖主講的簡報，
就像剛才看到的那幾位。
用你的聲音，
找到你的力量，
找到你的熱忱。
別錯過這不凡的時刻。
我們同心協力，便能確保
這個活動能夠引領所有人
走向一個健康、公正、永續的未來。
